They should provide slippers too, but the robes were a nice touch. Great location - 2 blocks from Union Square, and around the corner from Chinatown. They could use a better concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful value, fantastic location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: kellyblack
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of a hotel promotion to visit San Francisco for the weekend with our family and were wondering what to expect. We were very pleased by the beautiful lobby, inviting bar and restaurant, and friendly staff as soon as we walked in. Our room was spotless and excatly as pictured on the web site. A huge plus is the wonderful location. Next door to the Chinatown Gates, across the street from Cafe de la Presse and Starbucks and two blocks from Union Square (on the nice side). Highly recommended for a business or family stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for SF Christmas Shopping!”
Reviews.Author: GailandMeg
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter and I stayed at the Orchard Garden as an early Christmas visit together to do our shopping in SF for a long weekend. We LOVED the location of the hotel for walking anywhere we needed to shop, its green LEED rating, and great room with fluffy white duvets that we called "our cloud beds." Totally a good value with the prepaid internet rate. No need to rent a car--we took BART from SF airport and walked the two blocks from the Montgomery station. The Roots restaurant was a lovely dinner spot--I had the speciality Coconut Mojito which was stuffed with fresh mint and a yummy Dungeness crab on Mac and Cheese--the ultimate comfort-food entree. Friendly staff!! Gail, Washington DC

Reviews.Title: “Nice but perhaps over-hyped”
Reviews.Author: DctrD
Reviews.Content: I appreciated the philosophy and the decor of the hotel; however, I was disappointed by three things: (1) Despite their assertion that lowest rates are always found on their website, I was able to find a significantly lower rate via online resource (in this case, Hotels.com). Of note, I had even directly emailed the manager regarding rates, but was simply directed back to their website. (2) I had trouble picking up the "free" wireless in my room, and found my connection to be exceedingly slow. (3) Upon checkout, a charge for a minibar beer appeared on my bill although I never even opened the minibar; while this was ultimately removed, it should never have been there in the first place. I hope the hotel can improve these small annoyances, because it has the potential to be a really nice place.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Eco-friendly hotel in the heart of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: anutune
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Garden Hotel is a wonderful, eco-friendly, boutique hotel in the heart of San Francisco. It is a short walk from Union Square and just a few feet from the entrance to China Town. The rooms are exceptionally clean; the beds with their duvets are comfortable; and the staff is friendly and helpful. In addition, we enjoyed a wonderful breakfast in the hotel restaurant, Roots.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: travel_enthusiast2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really great, the location is near to everything: Union Sqare shopping, Cablecar, Financial district and Downtown, etc...Hotel itself is clean and nice and not noisy at all (in comparison to other hotels). We enjoyed our week long stay and would definitely return here the next time around! BTW: go and check the terrace with a great view that let's you relax for a bit during the content-packed days.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, and serene.”
Reviews.Author: CAKitty
Reviews.Content: Close to Union Square and Chinatown yet a great retreat from hustle and bustle.

Reviews.Title: “Everything so fresh and clean”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoJane
Reviews.Content: The room was small - European feel - efficient space - comfortable bed -clean fresh bedding - everything spotless - beautiful down comforter - good pillows - location is excellent - close to Union square - Chinatown - BART - good restaurants - we were very happy to be able to get an online special with very reasonable rates

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at this hotel! They send you to another much older Orchard Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AYC07
Reviews.Content: I made my reservation at the Orchard Garden Hotel because it is a new hotel and a green facility. The reservation lady informed me that she will price-match with discount travel websites and thus I price-matched my room rate with that of Hotels.com. I even called the Orchard Garden Hotel and confirmed my reservation an hour before my arrival. However, when we arrived we were VERY RUDELY sent to the other Orchard Hotel. The guy at the front desk told us, "what do you want me to do, you price-matched!!!!!" He didn't even apologize! So we walked up the hill with our luggage for a mile to the other Orchard Hotel. At the same time that we arrived we saw other travelers who were also bumped to this much older hotel. It was also not really a green facility (other than some organic stuff lying around!) and nothing really worked there. The next morning the toilet flush would not work and so maintenance had to come to fix it three times and it still didn't get fixed. Our whole morning was wasted waiting for maintenance and trying to find a new room!! To alleviate the horrible night and morning that they had created for us, we were told that we are given free breakfast but when we went to actually eat it the guy tells us that we are allowed two items from their breakfast bar!! and then he stands there watching and counting. It was cheap, distasteful and just ridiculous. From reservation and room problems to old toilets/flushing issues (which was just dirty, nasty, and unsanitary) to the many other troubles these two "sister" hotels created for us during our trip we certainly will not recommend this hotel. Your trip may be just as easily ruined by people who carelessly overbook their hotel and treat their guests with no regard.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: leo_aqua
Reviews.Content: Like other reviewers wrote: lovely hotel, very comfortable beds, friendly staff and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, PERFECT location!”
Reviews.Author: El_Mono
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pretty and VERY clean. Beds and rooms are comfortable and nicely appointed. But the real star is the location - perfect for walking anywhere in the city! Ten minutes to Moscone on foot. Ten minutes to awesome North Beach restaurants on foot. Five (or less) minute walk to Union Sq and all the best shopping SFO has to offer. Literally 10 steps away from the gates of Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location and rates”
Reviews.Author: pbansen
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Orchard Garden twice and have been very pleased both times. It's a small-ish property - probably 80 rooms - but the rooms are very comfortable, immaculate and there's a nice bar and restaurant in the lobby. Great location - right next to the Chinatown Gate at the south end of Grant Street, restaurants and shopping (Union Square) are all close by and very good. Friendly staff and good prices. A great place to stay when you're in San Francisco for business or fun.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat visitor and still impressed”
Reviews.Author: MisterTripster71
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Garden Hotel has exceeded our expectations--for a second time. We returned because we love the location, the rooms, the green concept and the staff. Pay a little extra for the "view" rooms and be treated with a balcony and spacious quarters. We will look forward to returning to this great boutique hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: AdTrosa
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay at a really nice hotel with a good location in San Francisco, I suggest you stay at Orchard Garden Hotel. It is only three years old and very nicely decorated. The room was not that big, but it had a big bathroom, bath robes, safe, a docking station for my iPod and more. The staff was very friendly and helped us both with a nice restaurant (Sam's Grill and Seafood) as well as direction when we headed off to the airport. The hotel is located just next to the gates to Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - enjoyed return visit”
Reviews.Author: UKBornToTravel
Reviews.Content: This is the fourth time I've stayed at the Orchard Garden while in San Francisco on business and once again enjoyed my stay. Room this time was a twin on the 10th floor (top floor) rather than a king and consequently, the room and ensuite was a bit tighter for space than previous rooms I've stayed in at the OG, so if you want a king, make sure you request it. However, very comfortable all the same and the staff were great. The room was always immaculately prepared, apart from the minibar, which I used on a couple of occasions. The products I used were never replenished during my 10 day stay and the fridge was never really cold. Also, in the past, there were snacks in the room to purchase, such as M&Ms and Kettle Chips, but this time there was no sign of these. Don't ask me why. Also, for some reason, the air conditioning noise was very loud in my room, especially in the bathroom, which was occasionally annoying. Otherwise, nice comfortable hotel, helpful staff, and a good location, making it easy to shop and see the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Super... in every way!”
Reviews.Author: intlgranolagirl
Reviews.Content: Loved the green concept! Green hotel from the recycled materials to build it to the recycling bins in each room. The hotel staff was extremely helpful with whatever we needed (directions, restaurant recommendations, holding our luggage after checkout until we actually left, etc). Great location (right next to Chinatown Gate and walking distance to Market Street, cable cars, SoMa, Ferry Bldg). Nice sized rooms with comfortable beds, big enough tub to fit 2, lots of light if you open the curtains... We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, relaxing, modern, and very clean”
Reviews.Author: manuku
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay! Everyone was very friendly and accommodating. Our room was a good size, and the organic toiletries are yummy. The meat-heavy menu in the restaurant was the one surprising exception to the hotel's environmentally friendly practices. We'd stay there again any day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful "green" hotel with friendly staff and great location.”
Reviews.Author: PVRalph
Reviews.Content: A very nice and still new hotel with excellent service. Every contact with the personnel left a positive impression. They live up to their "green" focus including small recycle containers in the room. We were in S.F. for medical reasons and requiring a lot of time in the room after the procedure so the free WiFi and DVD library/player was very welcome. Did not try the restaurant but used the excellent Cafe de la Presse restaurant across the street for breakfast and a couple of times for dinner. Bed was excellent. The only negative about the hotel is that (as described in some comments) the room was very small. We had a junior suite which wasn't large enough for a standard size lounge chair as part of the furnishings. The hotel did provide one when asked though we had only limited space for it. There was also very little drawer space - one each in two night-tables next to the bed and two small drawers directly above the bar-refrigerator (nice warm undies each morning). OTOH the bathroom was huge and very nice - two sinks, bathtub and shower. Hotel was clean throughout and they enforce a no-smoking policy. It was in a great location, just steps away from Chinatown, a few blocks from Union Square, and easy access to the Embarcadero. Fitness room has excellent equipment but only one of each kind (stairs, jogging, bicycle). Parking for a fee (usual for downtown SF) but at least they were prompt in bringing the car. Would definitely stay here again if I didn't have to spend a lot of time in the smallish room.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Modern 'Green' Hotel”
Reviews.Author: screennamesf
Reviews.Content: This is a very modern "Green" hotel - rooms had separate bins for bottles, paper, trash, etc. Everything seemed very clean and well maintained. Front desk staff were friendly and attentive. Beds were very clean and comfortable, especially with the down comforters. Housekeeping staff were almost a bit too attentive (just be careful when using those "Do Not Disturb" cards - one side says "Please clean room early!") Hotel itself is VERY small - lobby has no lounge area, just the front desk and the restaurant. Rooms also have dvd players, which I wasn't expecting. Free dvds are available for rent if you ask at the front desk - not a huge selection though. Room service is extremely expensive for what you get - I would not recommend that. Otherwise, hotel experience was generally good.

Reviews.Title: “VERY nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Gui_Machelen_Belgium
Reviews.Content: We arrived during the Labor Day weekend. Bay bridge closed. We found a very helpfull and friendly staff and a hotel conveniently located. The room was clean, the size as expected. For the breakfast, we choose the buffet. The choice was really ok. The service was correct and staff very friendly. Just one negative : the price for the parking. Otherwise : outstanding

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: crewelwanda1
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about the Orchard Garden. The location was perfect within walking distance to China Town and cable cars. The area was very busy and totally safe to walk around at night. The staff at the Orchard Garden went out of their way to make our stay pleasant. At our request they gave us a beautiful room high up on the 7th floor overlooking Bush Street where we really got a feel for the big city experience surrounded by skyscrapers and looking down at the street traffic and busling pedestrians. Our good size upscale-decorated room had wall to wall full length windows, luxurious bed and bedding including a fluffy white cotton comforter, two upholstered chairs and a table, flat screen TV, stocked refrigerator, large modern bathroom and white terry robes in the closet. Our only complaint was the hotel charge of $40 a day for parking plus a tip ($135 for 3 days) when the bellman delivered our car. The parking garage was about half a block down the street and we could have easily parked our own car for much less after unloading our luggage curbside in front of the hotel. We had breakfast and a dinner in the small hotel restaurant which was very nice with good food. Highkly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable hotel with friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: GranolaGirlCanada
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in September 2009, and had a great experience. The hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful. Cleaning staff did an amazing job. We loved the fact that this is a 'green' hotel and no harsh chemicals are used for cleaning. Thank you to everyone at Orchard Garden for making our stay such a pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “Location..Comfort..Welcome Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: athinasunshine
Reviews.Content: absolute perfect location! gorgeous room Super comfy bed! very friendly staff I will stay again for sure as I will recommend to all! Loved it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “green and nice”
Reviews.Author: MATTHI
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely one of the better places to stay. After staying at the big name hotels up on the hill, this was a definitely a nice change. For environmentally sensitive people, this is an oasis, no toxic cleaning material, great organic and biodynamic, some local, food. Nice wine selections. Friendly, unpretentious staff, FREE internet (as opposed to the expensive add on of some other business hotels), and did I mention the friendly staff? Will come back here. This may become my hotel of choice if I have to stay in the city.

Reviews.Title: “orchard garden, more like barren orchard”
Reviews.Author: didiasku
Reviews.Content: the reviews i read were very intriguing so my wife and i tried it out for 2 nights. the reviews couldnt have been further from the truth. the room was clean and thats about where it ended. 45 dollars a night to park, kinda ruins their cheaper rates entirely. the only thing saving this hotel is the location. Upon check in, we were told we were being upgraded, i'm really scared of what the room we booked looked like as our upgraded room was very tiny. in the lounge, the bar tenders didnt want to get some of the liqueurs on the top shelf b/c, well, they just didnt feel like it. no lunch or breakfast offered in the room b/c of t he economic conditions? dont all hotels massively overcharge for these services? I would think you keep those services and drop others. free internet was nice, but almost was as slow as 56k dial up. maybe ive become a hotel snob, but I would not recommend this hotel unless you really are on a tight budget and dont have a car/rental car.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly small tariff for a great experience”
Reviews.Author: alohatripper
Reviews.Content: Sept 7-10, 2009 We spent three nights here after finding an attractive rate on Expedia. Never been to this hotel previously, we are always skeptical of urban-boutique, and particularly San Francisco, hotels. I didn't want a re-do of a smallish, skid-row hotel in the Tenderloin, or what some refer to as "lower Nob Hill." But even in the better sections of San Francisco, we couldn't help notice a lack of street cleaning and an increase in homelessness. Happily, this hotel is practically brand-new and well-maintained. Everything seemed to work properly. The lights work in an European fashion--a card-activated light system to reduce wasted electricity. The water pressure in the showerhead was strong. There was both a safe and mini-fridge. The bedding offered a restful sleep. As with most urban hotels, parking can be bothersome and expensive. Luckily, the Stockton-Sutter garage is across the street and offered secure and relatively cheaper parking than the alternative. There are several coffee shops and restaurants nearby. Starbuck's is diagonal to the hotel and opens at 5:30 AM. The hotel does not have morning coffee service in the lobby, but it does have complimentary newspapers. I really liked Orchard Garden Hotel especially with the pricing and location.

Reviews.Title: “Defines the best of boutique hotels”
Reviews.Author: dkeith
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a great week in 2008. Searched for another place to try in 2009 but, after not finding a better combination of price, location and quality, returned for another week in 2009. We were not disappointed as overall presentation of the property remains superb and cannot see how location could be any better. If anything staff were even friendlier than last year and continue to deliver a high level of service in many small ways. I would agree with another reviewer that the air conditioning output could be improved upon and water flow from the shower head was a bit low but these could in part be connected to green initiatives and did not detract significantly from overall stay. The in room WiFi was a great plus and allowed use of my iPod touch when searching for tourist info and restaurants. Will not bother looking elsewhere in future as this is hotel of choice for San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “What can I say.....”
Reviews.Author: WorldRoamersUSA
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best hotel in the USA we ever stayed in. Who cares the "view" on some backyard from the window. Not one sound from the busy Bush Street can be heard. The rooms on front should be sound proof according the hotel staff. The breakfast is basic and rather expensive. Cold hard boiled eggs, bread, coffee or tea and juices from the bottle and of course some cereals. For additionals high priced extras can be ordered. We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. The dinner food is great, but the choice very limited, so we had to go to the French restaurant Restaurant de la Presse on the opposite of the entrance in Bush Street. One remark about the sound proof quality of our room. At one moment it looked like our neighbours were really inside our room. They had a normal conversation and we could understand every word of it!!! So we were just lucky with quiet neighbours who did not shout or laughed loud or put on the TV set maximum! You better go for a room without connecting doors. The hotel is extremely "green" and was awarded for this, too. Free WiFi, which works fast all the time. A special compliment to the porters, who proved to be very helpful with good tips.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: Unclelatch
Reviews.Content: This small modern boutique hotel was a joy. Perfectly placed about 20 yards from China Town Gate on Bush Street it is within easy walking distance of Union Square and transport links to the rest of San Francisco. The staff are very efficient and friendly and the public ares of the hotel are clean, bright and very modern. The rooms are extremely comfortable and furnished to a high standard. The beds and linen are among the best I have ever experienced. Highly recommended, and like the lettuce this 'Little gem' is also green, with a commendable environmentally friendly policy.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but beware of negatives”
Reviews.Author: SINN
Reviews.Content: Positives: Location; cleanliness; style (we found everything very tastefully decorated; comfortable beds etc; nice rooftop terrace where you can bring your own drinks and food or bring it from a bar in the lobby with a good selection of specialty mixed drinks. So-so: small room; bathroom sliding door that does not latch; very low flow showers. Negatives: Impotent climate control system and no windows to open. We got back to the hotel around midnight on a cool breezy evening, albeit after a warm day. Room (#808) was warm and stuffy. Remember, they have the European system of your key needing to be in the slot to power the lights and A/C. We turned everything on. Lowered the set temperature. Some cool air appeared to be coming from the vent, accompanied by considerable fan noise, but clearly not enough to do any good. For the next few hours we laid there sweltering and periodically going over to the window in the vain hope of finding something to open and maybe catch a breath of fresh air. No such luck. Had we been able to open a window, we would've turned the stupid thing off and saved tons of energy; instead it kept going the entire night and only toward the morning had the room become bearable. It is silly to find yourself sweltering and suffocating in San Francisco !!!! That's why I would not recommend this hotel to a friend. GREEN has to be people friendly too. If you gonna have an on-demand climate control system, you need to make it powerful enough to quickly bring the room to a comfortable condition and then it can go into an energy saving mode.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option in a great location”
Reviews.Author: tapperstravel
Reviews.Content: In very easy walking distance to Union Square, this is a bit of a hidden gem. It's fairly recently opened and has a bit of a hippy green eco thing going on, but unobtrusively so and there's a nice enough feel to the place. The quality of the food in the restaurant is very good indeed - a must-try, and frankly excellent value. I had a couple of minor niggles which I spoke to the staff about and I must say my niggles were sorted out very quickly and very professionally - if you are unhappy about anything, just say the word and they really will bend over backwards to help resolve them. I can't iterate enough how good they were in this respect. The rooms are fine, clean, spacious. If you are travelling with a baby, make sure you negotiate the cot because it seems on some occasions they may charge a supplement, depending on how you booked. Summary: Location excellent, Price very good, Restaurant excellent, Staff excellent ... what more can you ask?

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable, and convenient”
Reviews.Author: PeaceOnEarthForever
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week with my teenage daughter. The location was convenient for sightseeing and shopping (within walking distance of the PIers and Union Square) . The orange and lavender- scented shampoo and hair conditioner were great, although on two occasions, the cleaning person left us two bottles of shampoo and no conditioner, or two conditioners with no shampoo. I would recommend this hotel to a friend, but maybe not so much to big families with young children because it has a quiet ambience to it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic,clean,friendly and highly recommended.....”
Reviews.Author: whitt1
Reviews.Content: On arrival at the Orchard I was impressed by the service we received. Nothing was too much trouble and our bags disappeared as we checked in. They arrived at our room at the same time we did. The hotel is GREEN and whilst this may not be important to some travellers it may appeal to others. The room was immaculate and as my wife is very pernickety about cleanliness I was a little concerned it may not meet her high standards. I need not have worried, the room surpassed her expectations. Turn down service was offered on both nights of our stay. Would stay again if we visited San Francisco and would have no hesitation in recommending to others.

Reviews.Title: “Green Luxury”
Reviews.Author: princessandthepea_9
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Garden truly makes eco-friendly travel a delight. The aesthetics are soothing and beautiful. The staff are top notch in their friendliness, patience, and knowledge of the area. The rooms are luxurious and comfortable with all sorts of green amenities like organic bath products, recycling bins in-room, and the smartest thing to hit US tourism - key cards to activate the electricity in the room when you are actually in it. The location is wonderful with easy access to all San Fran has to offer. I stayed for 6 nights and could have moved in! Gold star - I am completely satisfied with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, homey and comfortable experience”
Reviews.Author: HowieMHonolulu
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I stayed at this hotel and will return again in October. I have been truly impressed. As for convenience, couldn't be better. I own a condo one block away and have my car parked there. Condo is rented so you are my second choice. I have told many friends already about the hotel. They are going to mention it to their friends when coming to town. It's hard to find places to stay that are as nice and priced right.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: bongo54
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 - Mum, Dad and teenagers aged 16 & 19 have just returned having spent 9 nights at the hotel and we were all delighted with it. Rooms were quiet, clean & comfortable (beds brilliant) and bathrooms provided herbal 'eco' toiletries and large fluffy robes - a nice touch. Staff were all great - very welcoming (as was almost everyone in San Francisco), nothing too much trouble. In particular Art on the front desk was really helpful with advice on where to go and best ways to get there, and nothing was ever too much trouble. We ate breakfast a couple of mornings, and had one evening meal - food in 'Roots' was very good. Location was excellent - just a few strides from the ChinaTown Gate. We walked a lot and had no problem finding our way around. Did also use various transport - cable cars (just for the experience), buses, trams etc - transport system is excellent. On our first full day we took a 5 hour city tour with Dylan's City Tours. There were just 13 of us in a small tour bus, and Dylan is such a great guy we felt like we were travelling with a family friend - highly recommended. We also took another tour to Carmel and Monterey with Great Pacific Tours. Once again a small tour bus with just 11 passengers and a lovely tour guide, Mary. This tour includes lunch in Carmel which was in a lovely restaurant and saved us wasting our limited time looking for somewhere to eat. Also gave us an opportunity to chat with fellow travellers. Most memorable thing we did ourselves was probably Alcatraz - definitely not to be missed, but in line with comments I have seen from previous reviewers book before you travel. We pre-booked and when we visited Alcatraz there were signs up saying sold out for next 5 days. A previous reviewer refers to a 50's diner which didn't suit them - this was probably Lori's and we loved it. I'm a sucker for all the old music and enjoyed feeding the jukeboxes, but more to the point the food and the service were excellent. We much preferred it to Sear's which is highly recommended but which we found to be dark although the food was good. If you are tired in the evening and don't want to walk too far, turn left out of the hotel and walk down about a block and a half to Belden. There are several little bistros along this lane and it has a nice atmosphere. We ate in Cafe Bastille (Parisian) and B-44 (Catalan) and would recommend both. We also had a lovely lunch one day at Pier 39 - Fog Harbour Fish House - clam chowder, swordfish, crab cakes etc. - superb. We also loved the Italian district around Washington Square, North Beach where there are lots of great places to eat. If there are any mechanical/technical fans in your party, the Cable Car Museum is worth a visit. It's not just a museum, it's also the winding room providing the power for the whole system. It's very hot and noisy but very interesting. We all loved San Francisco - the climate (warm while we were there - just needed a sweater in the evening and a jacket whilst on a ferry), the people (very welcoming), the sights, the places to eat, the hotel ... really everything about the place!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place, great service!”
Reviews.Author: laurenpk
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to add the excellent reviews of this place. We just got back from 3 nights there as part of our 6 day California trip. The hotel is clean (rooms and other spaces), has a lovely rooftop area with some plans and tables/chairs, and we experienced really great service. Whoever was at the front desk was always willing to give us tips, look up restaurants, etc. Also, it is a green-hotel, which seems to be a novelty, and it's always nice to feel like you're not killing the environment :). Great location as well- a couple blocks from Union square, right next to Chinatown, near the Ferry building, etc. We LOVED it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Thoroughly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Hils11London
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights on the last part of our Honeymoon. I cant recommend the hotel enough. The rooms were spotlessly clean, wonderfully decorated and very comfortable. Maid service was excellent. The location of the hotel is perfect for both union sqaure and is right on the edge of China Town. The cable car is only a block away and it is a leisurely 20 minute stroll to the piers. The staff in the hotel could not have been more welcoming or helpful. I wasnt sure what our stay would be like as I usually book hotels by recommendation but the Orchard Garden Hotel totally exceeded our expectations. I would recommend this hotel to others and if we ever get back to San Fran we will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jidrooms
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It was centrally located on the edge of Chinatown and the financial district. MUNI and BART were only a few blocks away. The hotel also has FREE internet, which should really be the norm at hotels these days. Four and five star hotels in the area are not offering this useful amenity. Orchard Garden is a green hotel, but retains a the feel of a luxury hotel with plenty of space.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean, friendly personnel, no problems whatsoever”
Reviews.Author: subterranean_jack
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orchard Garden Hotel for more than a week on business. The breakfast buffet was high quality excellent food. Servers were very good. Room was somewhat compact, but not a problem with so much to do nearby day or night. Chinatown is literally 50 paces away, but yet hotel is clearly part of the Financial District. Lots of nearby restaurant choices from fast food to fine dining. Nearest BART station is about 4 blocks away, easy walk. Rate is a little expensive, but I probably ended up saving money because I didn't rent a car and didn't miss one during the entire stay because the hotel location is so central to business, entertainment, and dining. Everything in the hotel was very clean and efficiently run. All personnel did a super job.

Reviews.Title: “This is a winner--Clean and professional”
Reviews.Author: BetaSX
Reviews.Content: Over all the rooms and whole property were outstanding. Very clean, the cleanest I've seen. The only thing I was disappointed in was perhaps the room (2 dbl beds) could have been a tad bigger. Very quiet room on the 8th floor. Bathroom was outstanding in cleanliness, size and ease of use of shower and the sink faucet was the best I've seen anywhere. I noticed some fluctuating shower water pressure but relatively minor annoyance really. Counter size was excellent. Beds were outstanding as well... very comfortable... slept very well. Prices in the hotel cafe seemed a bit high, food was great, service could have been a bit faster, but overall not bad. Lobby staff was efficient and friendly, eager to answer our needs. Parking (through valet) was $40/day which seemed high for a hotel but I guess that's the going rate these days. I would easily come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Service IS INCREDIBLE!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sabrina0074
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because I was in San Francisco for a surgery and I read that this hotel is very accomodating to people with disabilities. I wasn't sure how limited I would be after the surgery so I knew I needed a place that could handle any of my needs. From the get go, the service at this hotel stood out. They offered to arrange a wheelchair for me and also offered to handle any arrangements that I needed. The staff are incredible! They are professional and extremely helpful! The beds were very cozy and the room was clean and very nicely decorated. I enjoyed the energy conservation and think that more hotels should offer this. They also have evening turn down service which was nice. I can't say much about the view, it was a view of other buildings and the street but you know, the noise was non existant. I read a lot of reviews about noise being such a problem in many of area hotels. This was not a problem at all, I was never troubled by noise. The only down side of the hotel is the honor bar in the rooms. It's a small broken refrigerator that has different types of very over priced drinks. Example, a can of soda is $4.00. Who wants to pay 4 bucks for a hot can of soda? There was a display in my room that was supposed to have snacks (over priced as well) but it was empty. When I brought it to the staffs attention, they advised me that they were in the middle of finding a new vendor to handle their honor bar service which was why they weren't working and items were missing. That's not a problem except that they don't even have vending machines! So if you want a drink, you either have to bring in your own or order from the restaurant. That was a bit of a drag for such a nice hotel. I think they need to just get rid of the honor bar completely and add some vending machines to this hotel. It's certainly not a service to a customer to charge them $4 for a hot can of coke. Overall, I thought this was a very nice hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BlackIslers
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in July 2009. The room was excellent; very clean and spacious. It was just a floor down from the roof garden and was very quiet. The staff were very helpful. We did not eat at the hotel so cannot comment on the food. The one discrepancy on the bill (mini bar) was quickly sorted out. Car parking at many of these hotels in SF is a problem(expensive) - but as we didn't have a car it didn't affect us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: DodeeR
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Staff was attentive and accomodating. Rooms were sparkling clean. Location was great. Beds were heaven. Don't hesitate to book it. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “It was perfect for me! Would def recommend!”
Reviews.Author: dayk500
Reviews.Content: Although my stay was only one night, it was great! Located right next to the Chinatown gate, I couldn't have asked for a better location for my final night in San Fran. I loved the fact that it was a green business as well- not many hotels go to the lengths they do to be green. The bed was fabulous with extremely comfortable and fluffy bedding. The service was great- all questions and needs were taken care of. Wireless access in my room and a printer available downstairs in the business center were convenient. ~4 blocks from BART (montgomery st station). Very clean and well kept hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: lafayette83
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are experienced travelers who found this hotel to be a "Gem". The room was very clean with tasteful modern furnishings as well as a spotless bathroom. The location was great, being within walking distance of many of the interesting neighborhoods and sites of San Francisco. Another plus of this hotel is the wonderful staff, especially at the front desk, who were most helpful and eager to please. Additionally, the hotel is reasonably priced and is an exceptional value.

Reviews.Title: “An Extremely Rare Gem”
Reviews.Author: kimondavid
Reviews.Content: If you want to feel right at home and in the perfect location with special amenities and personal touches while in SF then you have to stay at the "The Orchard Garden Hotel". It is simply an amazing and wonderful place to stay. What makes it so special and unique and a wonderful experience are the people. They will make you feel extraordinarily special and so welcomed from the minute you pull your car up to the curb. From Art and Davis at the front door to Jane, Aya, Quinn, Troy, Marilisa, Nestor, Kelly, Crystal, Marie, Beth at the front desk they all go far above and beyond what any other hotel staff I have ever stayed at anywhere in the world. Yes I mention all of their names becuase they are all so wonderful, very special and unique in their own way. The Orchard Garden Hotel seems to only hire the very best of personalities and people in the hotel industry and they keep them. It is a wonderful group from top to bottom and it carries over to the guests that stay there. They are simply put the best group of people I have ever experienced in not only a hotel but probably any other organization. They are Exceptional.......... Words can't describe just how warm, courteous, helpful and how much they all want to make your stay as special as possible... There is not another hotel experience that even comes close to the experience you will have staying at the Orchard Garden Hotel................

Reviews.Title: “This is my new favorite place to stay in SF!”
Reviews.Author: stephnewyork32
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at the Orchard Garden Hotel. They not only let me check in an hour early, they upgraded me to a top floor room. The bed was THEE most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. The robe was so comfy I didn't want to take it off. It was hard to leave the room. The front desk staff was super friendly and helpful. I have never had such great service at a hotel before. The location is perfect and it was very easy to take muni across town. It is close to the major shopping area, union square, many great restaurants~expensive and not expensive. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone staying in SF, especially if you don't know the city that well. :0) (I paid in advance and that made the rate an even bigger deal!)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Lorstravels
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located on Bush Street right next to Union Square and to the cable car line. It is a new hotel and its rooms are decorated to a very high standard. The beds were very comfortable, plenty of space in room with two Queen beds, bathroom large with gowns and all toiletries supplied. We opted for breakfast included and we were not disappointed. They had an excellent choice of continental breakfast and hot breakfasts if you were prepared to pay extra. Tip: check their online rates daily as they change daily. If you ask for an exterior room, street view, then be prepared for some noise from the street. There are great French restaurants (mostly serving americanised good food) just across the road and there is a National/Alamo car rental shop just two blocks further up Bush Street. Overall, would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon pit-stop in the city”
Reviews.Author: Chillie73
Reviews.Content: This was the second hotel we stayed in on our Honeymoon in California. For the last leg of the trip we were looking for a basic, local hotel in the heart of San Francisco while we toured the city. The hotel was clean (eco-friendly a HUGE plus!), the staff were beyond helpful, and we had absolutely no complaints. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a comfortable stay in a big city. There was a nearby alley-way full of great, trendy restaurants that were a real highlight for us. We would definately go back again.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, just perfect”
Reviews.Author: kagian
Reviews.Content: Our family just got back from SF and really enjoyed our stay at the Orchard Garden. The staff from the front desk to the bar to housekeeping were top notch and friendly. The happy hour at Roots was fun, great fries!! Roof top was a nice place to sit and chat (can be cool up there!) I loved the location! Walk across the street to Irish Bank Pub for casual dinner and drinks.They serve food until 10:30 ish, bar open later. Two blocks away on Kearny is Bread and Cocoa where I had a great cup of coffee and wonderful pastry. Shopping is a couple of blocks away and you can find just about any store you like there. The area looks and feels safe. My 21 year old would have liked a more lively night life near the hotel but it suited me just fine. Be sure to take a sweatshirt jacket. It can turn very windy and cool at times. Long pants are better than shorts.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and terrific value.”
Reviews.Author: makruger
Reviews.Content: This very nice hotel is located in the heart of downtown San Francisco, at the edge of Union Square where it intersects with China Town. We ended up utilizing a cable car that ran down California, which was only a two block walk. (it was much less crowded that the other cable lines.) The staff was very nice and the valet parking was invaluable. We didn't eat at the restaurant (too many other dining choices!), but it looked welcoming. Everything in the room was perfect, from the nicely appointed bathroom, to the comfortable bed. WIFI service was reliable. We wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal”
Reviews.Author: SteffiV
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here in June. We wanted somewhere central within walking distance of the main attractions and transport in SF. The hotel is at the corner of Bush and Grant, right next to the China Town gate. We stayed in a corner room on the eighth floor. It had two side windows on either side of the bed, as well as the main front window looking onto Bush St. This meant that the room was very bright and airy. The pale green decor was also very welcoming and soothing. It was spotlessly clean - no dust anywhere. One day when we were leaving the room we saw the maid scrubbing the door of another room - now I have never seen that before! The staff were friendly and welcoming and always acknowledged you when you entered and exited the building. They were very helpful when we checked out as we had a few hours to wait before we needed to be at the airport. They held onto our bags and even arranged for a taxi to pick us up from the front door at the exact time we requested it. This is a green hotel and this is evident in a number of ways. There are separate bins for different types of recyclable waste, plus they don't print you a receipt when you check out. It has an ideal location and there are loads of places to eat nearby, as a result of which we never got to sample what the hotel had to offer food-wise. The only negative thing I have to say about the hotel is that our room was near the top, and the rooms above us had an outside patio area. Unfortunately on the last two nights our sleep was disturbed by the inconsiderate guests above us constantly re-arranging the patio furniture until about 3am. The sound of metal scraping against concrete directly above your head is not the best thing for a good nights sleep. This didn't detract from our experience too much though and we would definitely stay here again the next time we're in SF. This is a lovely clean hotel and we highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Experience”
Reviews.Author: JHMadison
Reviews.Content: Traveled with family (two kids ages 7 and 9). Staff was very welcoming and greeted us with chocolates (always a big hit with kids). Room and common areas were extremely clean and very spacious compared with other hotels in SF. Rooftop area lovely. Staff were helpful with suggestions. Location was perfect - easy walk to transportation. After a long day, the free DVD library was perfect for winding down.

Reviews.Title: “No fuss, no muss.”
Reviews.Author: boredCalgaryAlberta
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel w/ clean and comfy rooms, service @ a minimum but pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Have a great stay, and help the planet as a bonus (Green Hotel)”
Reviews.Content: Orchard Garden is a very nice hotel, with rooms, services, and amenities that make it competitive with the best boutique hotels in San Francisco. On top of all that, it is a wonderfully "green" hotel -- with a serious committment to sustainability reflected in the design and operations. But you don't have to sacrifice comfort for that benefit -- helping the planet is just a nice "perk" for your stay

Reviews.Title: “Perfect city break hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Iadoreholidays
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with this hotel choice , the location is second to none, the staff helpful and friendly, the rooms spotless and modern, and the price was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “For the internet price, location and accomodations were good”
Reviews.Author: kab1962
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this hotel more. Unfortunately, there were too many little things that added up. Had two rooms with my family but they couldn't put us on the same floor. The temperature was difficult to regulate. Our room was never vacuumed. Housekeeping kept forgetting to bring washcloths and conditioner for the bathroom. Which, btw, had no where to set anything down. The "spectacular rooftop garden" was quite a bit of wishful thinking on their part! It's a windy strip of cement on top of the hotel (with metal patio furniture) that has a view of the hotel windows next door and the airconditioning units. I never saw a single person up there. The internet price was too good to pass up with the location in walking distance of Union Square, the Orpheum, China Town (next door) and cable cars. The room was quiet, servicable and clean enough. The bed was quite comfortable. I wouldn't stay there again unless I was on a tight budget. Oh well, I gave green a shot!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful and friendly place to saty - certifieddLEED building!”
Reviews.Author: CityGalAnnArbor
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of San Francisco - near the Chinatown gate and within walking distance of many sights. Breakfast was a disappointment, but the croissants across the street at the Cafe du Presse were worth going for. Rooms are a good size, scrupulously clean, with wastebaskets for recyclables. Altogether a very high rating - we went with friends and we all enjoyed staying here. Would recommend this hotel to anyone, including familes, Staff is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “We would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: Traveler3355
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect for foot travel to many of the cities sites. The service was fabulous, with a friendly, helpful, and courtesy staff. The room was comfortable and the view from the roof top garden of the city both daytime and nightime is awesome. The hotel is definitely a must when visiting San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel; I'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: Tim_in_Boulder
Reviews.Content: The greenest hotel in the city, and yet it doesn't cut into the luxury! With the recent hit to the economy, prices are way more affordable, and that leaves more in the budget for eating at the excellent Roots organic restaurant downstairs. They have decent wireless Internet, as well as a wired terminal in each room. It's free, but for longer stays you have to get a new code from the front desk from time to time. This is my biggest annoyance. The Internet access was good enough to be able to watch a Netflix movie on my laptop, which is saying something. The hotel is only a block from Belden lane (a whole row of four-star restaurants!), and within sight of the tourist entrance to Chinatown. And don't forget Bart a few blocks away. Muni access is equally close, though I don't know Muni well enough to tell you how easy it would be to get to, e.g., Fisherman's Wharf. Most of my business trips to SF involve walking to an office near the Ferry Building/Embarcadero Bart, which is just about a mile from the hotel. I find the rooms to be quiet--even the ones on the street side. If you're SUPER sensitive to noise, you can request an "inside" room, where the view isn't as nice, but it's completely silent. The A/C system is all digital and works great. OH, except for one thing: It forgets your temperature setting when you leave your room (the keycard is required to operate the A/C), so if you go out for ice and come back, you'll need to reset your temperature, unless you like 72 degrees. Overall it's my favorite hotel in the area, and I've been to a lot of them (I go to SF once a month, on average).

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVE YOU!”
Reviews.Author: teeroses
Reviews.Content: My 2nd visit at the Orchard Garden~both for celebrations. 1st time for 4 nights for mom's 75th & sister's 50th, 2nd visit 5/20 - 5/25 for daughters' 21st & 25th & my 49th birthday. Long story short, from the reservations to the customer service, we had nothing but the best of accommodations and outstanding service. We have so many fond memories to share. We wish we could remember all the names of the people that made us laugh & smile just thinking our stay. But to the few we remember, OUR greatest thank yous to MaryJane Haney, Reservations Mgr; Jim Bruels, Director of Business Travels; Ben Wakolbinger, Sales Coordinator; Aya Shiba, Front Desk Mgr; Art & Davis, best doormen; Sarah, Front Desk; and housekeeping for making our visit so much like home and welcoming and sharing the city with us. You have left imprints of the city and the Orchard Garden that we will treasure for years to come. Aya, thank you for working with me on my reservations with Great Escape and allowing us to benefit from a savings of $500+ for the five nights. The Wicked package is what we originally booked at at $204/night +$25 for the 3rd person, but at the last minute Aya graciously made the reservations change. If that's not great customer service! Location, Location, Location! The hotel is near the Chinatown Gateway, easiest way to give the taxi driver directions, even with the occasional language barriers we encountered. Walking distance to shopping, museums, cable cars, muni, & bart. Breakfast at Sears Fine Foods-yum! Lunch at Working Girls the California melt for starters. We valet parked, but with 3 women, worth the $45+tax/night, car kept safe and call 10min prior to depart to find your car waiting for you always with a smile & warm send off. We had a 7am departure, car heated and waiting, loaded perfectly by Art~ off to the airport until we meet again, Mahalo & Aloha from HAWAII! We will be back soon...

Reviews.Title: “The Best Value and Location in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: c0wgirli
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Orchard Garden hotel numerous times, both for business and pleassure. It is in a top-notch location in San Francisco, within walking distance to Union Square, shopping and the cable car lines. This is a boutique hotel which gives it character. The service and cleanliness of the rooms are unmatched. The rooms are small (because it is in the heart of the city), but they are eco-friendly, have iPod connections, flat panel TVs, COMFY beds, a mini-bar, Aveda bath products and granite appointed bathrooms. I would recommend this hotel when visiting San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, comfortable place with environmental plus”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelBerlin
Reviews.Content: I went to the Orchard Garden in May 2009. It is completely new building built according to the demanding standards of the US Green building Council. Very nice rooms, comfortable and sufficiently spacious, very clean, with a lot of attention given to detail. I felt at home and will come back. There is not better place if you want to stay in the Financial District of SF.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: MMarshall78
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to San Francisco/Napa for her birthday April, 2009. I chose this hotel after much research and wasn't disappointed. The property is well located within walking distance of union square and even the wharf if your really ambitious. One recommendation if you're going to see some of the museums - buy a CityPass you get entrance to the MOMA, deYoung, a bay boat ride, the Science museum, and best of all unlimited free transportation on the public transportation, including the cable cards, but not the BART. It costs $59 a person but well worth it, we bought it after the first day but it still more than paid for itself. Back to the hotel - it is very nice and quaint. The rooms are modern, clean but small, we didn't care so much for the small aspect because we weren't in the room for the most part. I suspect some of their suites would obviously be larger. All in all my wife and I were very pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: marybethVirginia
Reviews.Content: My grown daughter and I stayed at the Orchard Garden for several nights in Feb and were very pleased with our accommodations. The location coudn't have been better for touring the city and the staff was extremely helpful. Our room could only have been made better by the addition of a fridge and maybe a microwave...otherwise it lacked nothing. We will definitely plan on staying there again on our next trip to San Fran!

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, excellent service, good location to see San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: Fandt51
Reviews.Content: I was a speaker at a recent conference and chose the Orchard Garden at the recommendation of a local client. Service and location couldn't have been better. A comfortable walk to the Muscone Center and Chinatown right around the corner. This would be a good location to stay and see San Francisco. Sustainability is high on their priority list without giving up any comfort or amentities. Highly recommended for business or pleasure. Rooms are not large but very adequate. Very nice roof garden with view of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, location and staff”
Reviews.Author: JaySunflower
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay. The location was absolutely perfect (right next to the gate to Chinatown). The rooms were squeaky clean and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. The few things brought up by the rare previous negative reviews seem to have been taken care of. No sign of construction... Everything appeared to be beautiful and complete. Recycling was available in the room and our 2nd floor street facing room was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean new hotel with small rooms and not much else”
Reviews.Author: Juiced_Pixels
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying this hotel is very new and clean, so very comfortable to stay in. My complaint is that the rooms are very small, hardly enough room to turn around. There is no fridge to use, only one stocked with expensive drinks that can't be removed unless you pay for them. There is not much on offer besides the room, as breakfast isn't included in most room rates. Free wifi is good but continually having to log in is annoying. I was also very disappointed that booking a month in advance meant I paid much much more for the room than booking a week before travel. Oh well :(

Reviews.Title: “Just right”
Reviews.Author: Deborahsister
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just right for us - in the middle of everything, clean, quiet, comfortable! We were very pleased with the price per night that we found through trip advisor. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it... great value for SF”
Reviews.Author: carma223
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location, the friendliness of the staff, and what you get for your dollar, especially for San Francisco. We absolutely loved our experience at this hotel. We booked a standard double/double, and upon check-in were upgraded to a 7th floor deluxe... and a corner room at that! The room was HUGE for the city. Spacious, clean, beautiful -- great flatscreen TV and DVD player, beautiful granite bathroom, ridiculously comfortable beds and linens, and a powerful shower with hot water for days. My only very minor complaint about the room is that the mini-fridge is one of those sensor-type minibars, so you can't store perishable food you might purchase on your own. We stayed for 3 nights, and on our second night, we unfortunately had some obnoxious neighbors... at 11pm they were playing guitar, singing, banging on bongos and burning incense! (I'm an extremely light sleeper, and the room was VERY quiet -- no street noise, and even these loud neighbors were a somewhat muffled noise.) I called the desk, especially because the incense was bothering me... and they took it very seriously. They didn't merely call the room and ask them to be quiet, they sent up a team of security... the noise immediately stopped, as well as the odor. The next day, I checked to see if the same people would be in the room next to me, and they were -- however, the desk told me there had been a note made in the computer about the incense and noise, and that the people had been firmly warned and they would be asked to leave immediately if I had any more problems. As someone who is a frequent business traveler, I'm kind of used to being sometimes blown off by the front desk, but the Orchard Garden took my complaints seriously. The next night, there were no problems whatsoever. The only overall negative is that we really didn't like the hotel's restaurant "Roots." Food was mediocre, overpriced, not great service. But definitely not a drawback in a city where you have a ton of dining options within walking distance. One other fantastic feature is the free Wireless Internet! I will absolutely stay at this hotel on my next trip to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room, elegant, no chemical smells anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: saradrums
Reviews.Content: I hate chemical smells in hotels, and they all have them. At least, I thought they did, until I stayed at the Orchard Garden Hotel. Lots of hotels are lovely. This one made me feel good too! The service was great, the amenities above average, and the bed was one of the most comfortable I've ever slept in. No question, I'd stay here again in a heartbeat. Great location too.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!!”
Reviews.Author: dobermanSt_Louis_MO
Reviews.Content: totally caring staff a beautiful hotel, our third visit

Reviews.Title: “5 carefree nights in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: LexingtonVabene
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Garden Hotel surpassed my expectations. The staff managed everything from the telephone reservations to the 4:00 AM check out with profesional efficiency . The property was impeccable clean. The double/double room on the 9th floor was very quiet. There was no view but we did not spend a great deal of time in the room. We appreciated the comfortable bed, the heavenly linnens , fluffy towels, and the bathrobe. We ate breakfast at Roots restaurant. It was the best breakfast we had in the city. Sarah helped with restourant recommendations and airport transportation.

Reviews.Title: “A green hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: KGM77
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights in part of a longer trip around the Western USA. The location of the hotel is excellent for both tourists and business travellers alike being close to Union Square, Chinatown and the business district. Fishermans Wharf is a nice walking distance away if you want to blow off the cobwebs. The hotel lobby is relatively small and narrow, fitting in with the boutique theme, with a small bar, a small restaurant and a small business centre with a couple of PCs. I didn’t try the restaurant, there was a great French breakfast place opposite. I found the room to be excellent. Very modern, light woods, glass and really making a thing of the hotels green credentials. Free internet is always a good thing, and the room was particularly spacious, with a comfortable bed and good bathroom. The hotel is a solid 4-star and a good alternative to some of the name brand chain hotels nearby. I’ll definitely consider it next time I return to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: hotelsnob_9
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the clean, comfortable soothing colors of the hotel. Free internet is a great service. Valet parking is expensive, but it is San Francisco. Roots restaurant is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “An Organic Delight”
Reviews.Author: TDEmery
Reviews.Content: Rooms were sleek, clean and environmentally responsible. Staff were friendly especially the valets. The food, appetizers and wine selection were fantastic along with the guide to environmentally conscious shopping/eating. Never a bad steer. The only improvement could be the continental breakfast which was somewhat uninteresting, bland and non-organic.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Cha_mur
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel, in a great location: China town starts at the corner and the subway from the airport is two blocks away. The staff were friendly and helpful. The business centre is available and free, although there is a fee for printing. The room was quiet, lovely, spacious and clean and included tea/coffee making facilities. Union square was about a 5 min walk, where we went for breakfast at Sear’s. The hotel is in a great location to explore the city on foot and there is a car rental two blocks west if you want to rent a car and get out of the city for a day. This was the nicest hotel I’ve stayed in for quiet some time and I would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect small hotel in the heart of SF with a friendly atmosphere and very comfortable beds after a day in the City.”
Reviews.Author: cherylspook
Reviews.Content: We totally enjoyed The Orchard Garden Hotel and of particular note is the cleanliness of the room and bathroom. I left things out and had no worries about theft because the staff was small and friendly and seemed genuinely to care about making our stay a pleasant one. The beds are super comfy and luxurious! We had a room at the front of the hotel, 8th floor, overlooking the city street and it was bright and cheery and totally quiet. We could not hear anything inside our room. The free Wifi is another enjoyable bonus. I would definitely stay here again and have recommended it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great, beautiful, quiet, comfy and in our favorite SF location!”
Reviews.Author: Kelleyanne
Reviews.Content: Very ECO! No strange new carpet or paint smells - for a new hotel that is nice. Loved the linens, decor, bath products, bathrooms are large - and it is a very quiet hotel - unusual in the older hotels that are upgraded.. They did an excellent job with this property. This is also the best area of the city to stay in - with in walking distance to Union Square, China Town and yet - a relaxed area at night. Cafe Presse is across the street - one of the best breakfast haunts in SF and Lululemon Yoga a block away! Good Sunday a.m. team up!

Reviews.Title: “Two Thumbs Up!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelsForRaces
Reviews.Content: I was well greeted by the staff. Very helpful in my checkin process and how to get quickly settled for my stay. I got some good tips about the immediate area. Parking, places to eat ( I chose the Irish Bank! - very cool ) and the proximity of buildings to this one. The roof garden is a must see. It was quiet and serene. The room was great. Quiet, clean, new flat screen tv with plenty of channels and PPV movies. The room was well laid out and seemed very nice. It was cozy an comfortable. I totally enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good vibe from the hotel staff and a comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: CaliOhioMass
Reviews.Content: The hotel representative checking us in was so nice, and he upgraded us from an interior room to one with a view. Comfy beds, flat panel tv, nice scented toiletries: overall a really pleasant stay. The hotel is 4-5 blocks from Union Square (closer the financial district, which is much better than being closer to the Tenderloin) and about a 10-15 minute walk to the Montgomery BART station. We got a great advanced purchase deal through the hotel's website ($120/night). Overall, a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: momsweekend
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Orchard Garden Hotel for two nights, I wish our stay was longer. This hotel is beautiful, very clean and the staff is very friendly. I would definitely stay here again, I don't even think I would look anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the outdoor deck, rooms and location”
Reviews.Author: kshanfield
Reviews.Content: We were there for the weekend visiting our daughter, and it was a great time. The location for walking to restaurants and sights was perfect, and the rooftop deck was perfect for visiting with our daughter and her friends. We had the suite room since the price was right, and it was large, spacious and the bed was insanely comfortable. I can't say enough good things about our stay, and we felt good knowing it was all "green".

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/serene surroundings”
Reviews.Author: akusah
Reviews.Content: The room lived up to its name. The decor and space was fine. I requested an upgrade to an exterior room and it was great. No noise came into the room to disturb me. I have stayed in this area before and the Orchard Garden will be my choice again. I felt the restaurant was a little overpriced and it appeared that breakfast was the busiest time. However there are other places to eat nearby.

Reviews.Title: “this was a great value, and wonderful get-away for a weekend”
Reviews.Author: ubermeme
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a weekend in SF. I booked the hotel from their website which was a great value. Used some of the tips I had seen here about riding BART, and no hotel breakfast, good advice, as we were trying to have a weekend away that was not expensive. We had a very relaxing weekend. The rooms are great, beds very comfortable. We stayed on the inside and still had some street noise (says my hubby, the light sleeper) I heard no noises, so you need to judge based on your normal tolerance for noise. You are in the middle of a city for heavens sake! It was very easy to get around with public transportation, we also walked alot. The staff, including front desk, were very good to us. Don't miss the roof garden. Very nice place to sip a glass of wine, and view the city lights. Only drawback....I discovered the shopping area that is very close...and now want a trip with the girls. (not on the cheap! :)

Reviews.Title: “Clean & modern, overall staff friendly but beware of front desk staff....”
Reviews.Author: HappyGoLucky076
Reviews.Content: Hotel itself is new & modern, I like the energy efficiency of it with the card key turning on the power, and the in-room recycling bins. Free wi-fi internet is excellent. Bathroom is roomy and enjoy the toiletries. The bed is extremely comfortable. Love the bath robes & slippers. Rooms facing the street will hear street noise so if you are a light sleeper like I am, don't choose street view. We were on 7th floor and can hear street traffic all day & all night even with double pane windows. If you like a decent size room, make sure you book superior room size and up. Breakfast: don't eat at the hotel, and try places like Lori's diner near Sutter & Powell. The bell person, valet & security were all friendly & helpful. However, beware of front desk staff. We requested room change due to street noise & were downgraded to a standard room facing the back (we booked superior room)! After much arguing on the phone with the front desk guy and being told that "your reservation was a standard room", "all rooms facing interior were standard room" & getting real upset, he finally said "I will have to speak with the reservation department", we were eventually upgraded to a junior suite. On the day of checkout, we requested to check out 30 min late, and were denied by the girl at front desk, citing "too many other guests want to check out late". My husband and I travel a lot and were never denied late check out before. Basically what the front desk staff put us through made the stay at this hotel unpleasant. The front desk staff is unprofessional and needs more training on customer service and better people skills.

Reviews.Title: “a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Mista-go
Reviews.Content: To cut it short, I'd better say what we disliked about this hotel: 1) the view from our window was on a courtyard instead of on the streets of san francisco. But I guess it was only misfortune.... ;P 2) you were not allowed to open the windows. Apart from that, we simply loved this super-central, cosy, modern, comfortable, squeaky clean hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Like this hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: ontheway2
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about the Orchard Garden Hotel. My girlfriend and I stayed here in late January, 2009 for her birthday trip. We travel to San Francisco about 4-5 times a year for pleasure. What we liked: 1) The location of this hotel is absolutely the best. Chinatown, is right outside the front door. Ferry Building Plaza and Union Square are both easy walks. 2) Plenty of good restaurants are less than a mile away. 3) Great accessibility. To get here from the San Francisco airport, just jump on the BART ($5.35), take it to Montgomery Station and walk up to the hotel. 4) The staff is extremely helpful. They upgraded us after I filed a complaint about my room. 5) Our first room (a Junior Suite), although a bit small, was fine with a nice comfortable bed. What we didn't like: 1) We could hear way too much of what was going on in the next door room. We were awakened by the couple next door making love and then literally could hear their pillow talk afterwards. We were very surprised that such a nice new hotel wasn't designed to include adequate sound proofing. This problem was definitely a deal breaker for me and I complained to the front desk the next morning. They were extremely helpful and upgraded us to one of the top floor Terrace Suites which was great. So as I said, I am torn. I really like this hotel. But unfortunately, I am hesitant about going back. My girlfriend, on the other hand, is willing to give them another chance. So, if you stay here, be sure to mention that you want a room that is quiet (especially in the middle of the night).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, quiet, convenient...”
Reviews.Author: nkelley
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Garden this past weekend and loved it! The room was clean, simple and elegant. The bed was comfy and the sheets were super soft. The room itself was kind of small and there wasn't much space to unpack a suitcase, but the bathroom was huge with a gorgeous, large tub and separate shower. I'm a sucker for a beautiful bathroom! I also loved that they had dvds we could borrow to watch in the room when we didn't feel like leaving the hotel. The front desk folks were friendly and helpful and very accommodating. We ate dinner in the Roots restaurant and shared a delicious organic salad, free-range, organic pork chops and a yummy dessert. After dinner, we ordered cocktails from the bar and wandered up to the rooftop garden to take in the view. Overall, a lovely time plus I feel like I gained some good karma points just by staying here. :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful overall”
Reviews.Author: Indy_V
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from our stay at the Orchard Garden Hotel in San Francisco. He was there for business and I got to tag along and discover the city. The hotel was immaculate and the staff was nothing but accommodating and friendly. The room was very clean and comfortable. We were there over Valentine's Day and they did their best to find a restaurant for us on that day on very short notice. They were also able to provide us with a variety of recommendations on where to eat on the other days we were there. In regards to my interaction with the front desk staff, they were able to help me with all of my plans while I got around the city. The hotel is wonderfully located. Just down the street from China Town, a few blocks from Union Square, and a short walk to the variety of transportation systems. We had a fantastic time in San Francisco and really enjoyed our stay at the Orchard Garden Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: ddetravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel has always been out of my price range. So when I saw it for $99 per night on Expedia, I jumped at the chance to stay there for an upcoming conference. No regrets. In fact, I wish I could always afford to stay here when I'm in San Francisco. Just a short walk from the Montgomery BART station, I was warmly greeted by the front door man and the front desk. They were very professional and helpful. They told me I had the best room in the house, and they were right. I got a room on the 10th floor facing Bush street. I had a beautiful view of downtown San Francisco. And I've stayed at a variety of places in Union Square. My room was at the Orchard Garden was the quietest of them all. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was enormous. Full tub and separate shower and double vanity. Great bath products. A flat screen tv with a dvd player graces the room, along with free wi-fi in the rooms as well. Just make sure to get the code from the front desk. My room was large in contrast to other rooms in downtown San Francisco. I have no complaints whatsoever. A great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: KP&TP
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights on business last month and it was a pleasant although not perfect experience. Location is great, right next to Chinatown and close to Union Square, lots of places to walk to for food and coffee. The room was good, got upgraded to a superior king with a view to Bush street. Room was very quiet, bed and linens were great, loved the recycling bins right in the room too. The bathroom was large and laid out pretty well but I prefer more water pressure in the shower, I have long thick hair and it felt like it took me a half hour to wash it! Loved the EO products provided, especially the grapefruit mint glycerin soap. Would have preferred to receive USA Today rather than the local paper, and never saw the USA Today available in the lobby as was mentioned in the room, but oh well, that's no biggie. Fitness center had nice machines but there are only three (!) - one bike, one treadmill and one elliptical plus a small area with a mat and an excercise ball. I know it's not a big hotel but IMO there should be more machines available, a minimum of two treadmills and at least some free weights. Also thought it was gross that there was no sanitizer to wipe the machines with - yuck. Luckily, there is a lot of cardio available from the city itself :) Did not have room service since there are so many options nearby - Starbucks kitty corner from the hotel, Working Girl's Cafe going the other way (awesome place) and Cafe Amici down the block (wouldn't really recommend that one). Favorite restaurant of the trip? Capurro's down at the wharf - great seafood, pizza and steaks, awesome happy hour and fabulous service. We liked it so much we went there three times in four days! Had lunch at Nonna Rose down by the wharf and liked it alot, and went to the trusty Boudin for tasty and inexpensive food too. Also went to the Irish Bank Bar and Restaurant which I would never recommend to anyone - horrible food, service and the place was dirty. Two out of three of us got a stomach ache after dinner here. All in all, I would choose to stay at the Orchard Garden again. It's not my favorite hotel but it certainly fills the bill for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: anonj
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here last wk and had a good experience. Perhaps the front desk has improved because of TA complaints but we had excellent, prompt customer service. Front desk guys were friendly and helpful. They also rushed to assist us in hailing cabs, carrying luggage etc. We were also pleased to not see hardly an homeless people and so were not badgered or made to feel unsafe during our five night stay. According to many reviews of other SF hotels this is a chronic problem. So we're not sure what to attribute it to- apparently the mayor is asking people not to give the homeless handouts so that they will avail themselves of existing services or perhaps the hotel's location was better- between Chinatown and Union Square. Someone else complained about the mattresses being uncomfortable- we thought they were quite comfy- kind of a firm foam rather than box springs but not too firm. Linens were excellent quality- seemed to be all cotton with high thread count. Climate control was good and the room could be made cool enough at night to enjoy the down duvets. Our "superior" room with two double beds facing the front of the hotel was quite roomy but another room facing the back with a king bed was quite small. We heard almost no noise from other guests over five nights but the king bed to the rear reported some noise issues. Street noises were also minimal in our 7th floor room. Bar service was nice and we enjoyed the free appetizers with drinks which seemed quite pricey but are probably standard for big city hotels. The dinner menu looked good but I have a fear of most hotel dining... so often mediocre. We ate breakfast one morning across the street at Cafe de la Presse- a really cute fake French place.
