Reviews.Content: If you want a luxurious sleep - outstanding service and a reasonable - well for San Francisco - downright bargain - price -- The Orchard Garden Inn is hard to beat -- beautiful all green hotel -- outstanding 5 star hotel like service -- right at the gate of Chinatown - easy walking distance to virtually everywhere on the bay bridge side of the city. The rooms are cozy - modern - clean - the beds are amazing - so comfortable you don't want to get up. Would highly recommend this gem.

Reviews.Title: “The little things count!”
Reviews.Author: chic_traveler_8
Reviews.Content: From the moment I stepped my travel-weary body into the this hotel, I was instantly rejuvinated. My shuttle door was opened for me and my luggage brought inside where I was quickly checked into my room. Throughout my stay I was greeted by all employees and no request was too outlandish. Complimenty newspaper outside your door, great Aveda products, a selection of dvd's to watch on the flatscreen tv and a luxurious bath made it difficult for me to leave the room for sightseeing! The bed was extremely comfortable and their bathrobes are worth buying so you can have a little luxury at home. Location-wise, this hotel is an relaxing 10 minute walk to Union Sqaure and right next door to the China Gate. Cabs are easy to come by and there is a valet service available if you have a car. The room-service breakfast was delicious but if you would like some atmosphere there is a lovely french-style cafe across the road. Starbucks is one block over and a lovely sushi bar just down the way. There are a fair amount of homeless people in this part of town but I never felt unsafe - even when walking by myself at night. When my shuttle service did not arrive in time to take me to the airport, the lovely concierge offered up their towncar at no extra charge. I look forward to my next stay at this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A San Francisco Treat”
Reviews.Author: agnone
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Orchard Garden was wonderful. My husband an d I are from Northeast Ohio and booked the hotel after surfing the web and reading about it. We came in on a Friday evening and checked out Sunday morning. The hotel was exactly what we were looking for. The bed was great ...so comfortable and the room perfect. We did not have a view as we booked with AAA and that is generally an interior room. Others had mentioned small rooms in their reviews but the size of the room was not an issue for us. It was just fine for a couple spending a weekend in San Francisco. The colors were calm and soothing as was the DVD for a relaxing nights sleep. The staff was very accomodating, particularly a young man named Davis, who certainly went out of his way for us and the other couple we were traveling with. The location could not have been better just steps away from Chinatown , a two block walk to the cable cars and the trolleys and streetcars. also there were cabs at the hotel doorstep at any time .You are also just a few blocks from the italian North Beach neighborhood and the other way is Union Square.. There are several good restaurants just down the street. .Sunday morning my husband and I went to Mass and had our choice of where to attend as there are two beautiful Catholic churches within a two minute walk As for dress - in the winter it is dressy casual...lots of layers , gloves scarf and jacket , maybe a dressier coat for evening. But on the whole S. F. and the Orchard Garden is pretty casual. We will definitely stay here again, there is so much to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “A great value that can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl808
Reviews.Content: This wonderful boutique hotel is in a great location just steps from Union Square and Chinatown. The staff was friendly and helpful, and our room was tastefully appointed and comfortable. I loved the Aveda bath products, California King size bed, cozy comforter, and perfectly-weighted robes. The free internet access and DVDs were added bonuses. I also appreciated the recyling containers in the room and the free newspaper delivered to your door in the morning. Finally, not only was the price good, but you get great value for your money. After such a fantastic experience it would take a lot to convince me to stay anywhere else in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Full marks”
Reviews.Author: itchyfeet2
Reviews.Content: I was hugely impressed with this hotel - wonderful big rooms and beds; spacious bathrooms; pleasing colour schemes; fabulous breaktasts. And all just next to Chinatown. Then there are the eco-credentials; I'd say the Orchard Garden has set standards (locally sourced and organic food; recycling bins in rooms; reclaimed raw materials) that other hotels will have to follow in the future. It's not cheap - but then neither are other boutique hotels reaching a similar standard in this city.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch!”
Reviews.Author: vinylrules
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Orchard Garden Hotel was simply superb! What a gem. A truly beautiful hotel with an European flair, a super friendly staff, and at a great location to boot! The room was pure heaven with a super comfortable bed and a stunning bathroom. Loved the cushiony robes too! In fact, We meant to buy a set. The only word of warning would be that the rooms are rather small - some more than others - so be sure to ask to see the room in case you wish an upgrade. Since this was my wife's first time in San Francisco I did request a bigger room, also with a much better view -- and to our amazement, Jim, the manager at the time, made sure we were not charged for the upgrade! How great is that? Thanks Jim! (I hope this doesn't get you in trouble). All in all, a super delightful experience at the Orchard Garden Hotel. Needless to say...WAY highly recommended! (Pics to come)

Reviews.Title: “Great location for exploring the city”
Reviews.Author: viajera725
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location and friendly staff. The hotel is right near the gates of Chinatown and a couple of blocks from the shopping at Market Street. I would definitely stay here again next time I'm in SF. The big breakfast and environmental consciousness were a plus, too.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Mushy-47
Reviews.Content: This is a great find. It is in a perfect location, but that is not the best thing about this hotel. It is beautiful, the staff is amazing, the appointments and furnishings are lovely, the Leed Certification is the way of the future and all for an unbelievable value.

Reviews.Title: “Lovey hotel but I will not be returning!”
Reviews.Author: Debbiew4ai
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, clean and comfortable hotel. But here's the problem: the climate inside the room is too dry and stuffy. I chose this hotel because of the "green" atmosphere. The rooms are powered by placing the keys inside a slot near the door. The hotel is also new and allows no smoking in any of the rooms This is a plus because you can often smell cigarette smoke through the air conditioning system. Because it's a new hotel, apparently the building codes do not permit any windows to open. So this place is sealed shut. I was assured that the new "state-of-the-art " AC system was able to adjust and even allow for some outside air circulation. This was certainly not the case. I had to buy a cheap humidifier at Walgreen's in an attempt to get so moisture in the room. It helped a bit. I guess I'm confused about the description of "green" and this overall phobia of outside air. Here's a green tip: you can also cut your energy costs by shutting off the AC and opening a window!

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: circuitboitravel
Reviews.Content: Wow is all I can say! This was my 3rd visit here, and it just keeps getting better with each visit. The rooms are great, the amenities are nice, the Staff is incredible. The free breakfast was a treat. In the previous stays, I missed it due to my sleeping late. This time I made sure I went and ate. I love the fact the hotel is eco friendly! It was great to walk into China town, and be right there. It's very close to Union Square as well.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, eco-friendly and convenient”
Reviews.Author: fiftysomethingSue
Reviews.Content: For my first business trip to the city, I chose the environmentally friendly Orchard Garden, which was 3 blocks from my office away from home. The bed and breakfast package was a good value -- with fruit, cereals, baked goods, cheese and meats and hard boiled eggs available. Staff were very friendly, recommending a sushi restaurant 5 blocks away instead of the one across the street. Room was beautiful, clean, everything I expected of a business-class hotel. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Orchard Garden Hotel in SF!”
Reviews.Author: LovesToTravelBayArea
Reviews.Content: This a lovely gem....just a minutes walk into Chinatown or Union Square, this hotel is the best place we've ever stayed in SF. Small enough to maintain an intimate feel but without sacrificing any of the amenities. Light and bright, very clean, beautiful rooms, nice staff, good food and if all that's weren't enough, it's the first completely "green" hotel from the ground up. Though not inexpensive, for the value we found it worth every penny. We look forward to making this our permanent home base when visiting - for business or pleasure - San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: BreVar
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love to take road trips for our vacations so we have stayed in many hotels across the country. This hotel was GREAT! Nice location, very central to many places in san Francisco and it was a very nice part of town. The staff was very accommodating and friendly. They were almost all quite young and still very professional and helpful. they had a nice tv in the room, and the bed was very comfy. the room overall was very cozy. We would highly recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel great location, very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: ncginny
Reviews.Content: this is a very nice hotel very well run, hotel staff all very cordial and helpful. housekeeping also very polite and caring the room was inviting and bright - good lighting- perfect location downtown to everything, able to walk most everywhere. sheets and towels of good quality. a very good value for the price we paid. would recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, cozy”
Reviews.Author: lady_bec
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable bed (+), we liked that it is a green hotel. Nice tv. very cozy room, typical in san francisco. for the $, not sure you can't do as well or better. the location was great. also enjoyed the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “We Will Come Back”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravelGurl
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay. The rooms were clean and quiet and the location is great. The staff was pleasant and helpful. The only reason why I didn't give it 5 stars was due to the attitude of one staff person. When asking for directions, the front desk person told us to go use the business room and print them out ourselves. When we explained we were in a hurry, the person ignored us. Thankfully, another staff person came over and helped us out. However, this was a minor thing compared to the overall visit. We will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Little Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EvilDeeva
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Orchard Garden Hotel as part of our honeymoon from 09/10/07 - 14/10/07. It's a small boutique hotel where the staff were always helpful and friendly. It's a fantastic location; right next door to Chinatown. Union Square and the Financial District are both within walking distance, as are all the shops and Westfield shopping centre. The room was very clean and with it being a 'green' hotel there are separate bins in the room for rubbish, bottles and paper. We had a view of Bush Street which isn't particularly attractive but what do you expect in the middle of San Francisco?!?! There was a safe in the wardrobe along with an iron and ironing board; you also get free WiFi if you have your own laptop. Each room also has a Flatscreen TV, IPod docking station and coffee machine. There was a mini-bar and a tray with snacks that are all on sensors. We didn't eat any of these or use the mini-bar because they were soooo expensive. You get the option of turn down service each night; we didn't bother but it's a nice touch. There is a bistro downstairs called 'Roots' that serve breakfast, lunch (I think) and even an evening meal. We had breakfast included with the price of the room and it was really nice. A choice of pastries, muffins, bagels, fruit salad and cereal; along with tea, coffee and a variety of fruit juices. They also do room service. There is also a roof garden, but that was closed during our stay; we didn't realise though and went up anyway! It gives a fantastic view of the city at night. Whilst we were there one of the lift's broke down which was a bit annoying but I suppose these things happen; it just meant that with only one lift working we had to wait longer than usual. The WiFi also went down due to flooding in the street; but again these things happen, it's not really something that the hotel can control! The mainenaince guys were working all night in the street to try and get the problem sorted though. But the main reason I only gave the hotel 4/5 is because of the gym. They have a tiny room with a treadmill, a crosstrainer and a bike; for someone who works out 6 days a week this was a bit of a let down. You can use a nearby gym but I thought $15 per day was quite pricey so I didn't bother. The bar staff are very friendly, one of them even gave us a free tequila! The staff will recommend restaurants as well if you ask and are very helpful with regatrds to directions etc as well; they will also book you taxi's / city cars to get you to the airport etc. All in all we had a lovely stay at this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: Zusclare
Reviews.Content: While we loved the "green" aspect of this hotel, our stay was nothing special. The room was small, really too small for us. The hotel was also having some problems as result of a leak, so there was only one elevator working (and long waits for it) and the roof garden was not available. The hotel staff was very nice, but not particularly helpful. For example, when we needed a cab, they suggested we walk a few blocks to another street to find one. Another example, we wanted to go to the movies (it had been raining, we'd already enjoyed two museums) and we asked about nearby theaters; the theater names we were given were totally different from what was listed in the paper. Once we figured this out, it was too late to go to any of the movies we would have wanted to see.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, very good impression”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegan78
Reviews.Content: Overall, I was very pleased with my stay at the Orchard Garden. The place is perfectly located a few blocks away from Union Square and Financial District, right next to Chinatown. The property is impeccably clean, and the overall green-yellow color scheme is as soothing as it is sophisticated. The personnel were generally very helpful with everything with the exception of a single minor maintenance request that has never been attended to, eve n despite an extra reminder. There is a tiny fitness room with just a couple of machines, a business center and a hugely overrated "roof garden" which is basically of no use because of cast iron furniture - try to seat in one of these chairs for two minutes in fall and have your butt frozen, or for a change have it roasted after two minutes in summer. My room 1005 - top floor king - was spacious and light. The bed, mattress and linens were wonderful and the two-layer bath robe - from a local company "Telegraph Hill" - was easily the best I had ever worn. The bathroom was quite large, with a full bath and vanity mirrors. There was a room safe, a tea/coffee maker, HDTV unit, DVD player and an ipod docking station (=alarm clock) in the room. The air conditioning unit was effective and not noisy at all. My reservation included a complimentary breakfast - unfortunately, the same selection five mornings in a row. Valet parking was $32 + tax. There are just two specific concerns that I would like to bring my fellow travelers' attention to as they may be quite annoying. Firstly, their room access cards deactivate each time you use them to access business center. You have to trot to the front desk to have your card reprogrammed after each visit to the business center. Another - and potentially quite embarrassing - concern is the sliding bathroom door. Not only can it not be locked from the inside, there is a 2 1/2-in gap around the whole door panel opening into the rest of the room. Bearing in mind how exciting all those bathroom sounds - and smells - can be, I strongly doubt this solution was correct... To summarize, apart from the two ridiculous flaws discussed above, this is a wonderful hotel, very much to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “My New Favorite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: longrider_7
Reviews.Content: I was in San Francisco for a conference and my wife found this hotel on the internet. The web site was very appealing and the location was within easy walking distance of the convention center. It was also located next to other active areas of the City including Chinatown and Union Square. But, what attracted us mostly to the hotel is that it is "green", constructed to the guidelines of the United States Green Building Council. So we booked the room. From the time of arrival to my departure, I was not disappointed. The design is modern and exceptionally clean. The staff (all the staff) was very helpful and friendly. My wife and I prefer smaller hotels over the large chains and the Orchard Garden fit perfectly into this perception. The room was exceptionally and tastefully furnished including a large, flat-screen television and king size bed. The many energy conservation measures incorporated into the construction of the hotel were apparent and most appreciated including all power on/off with your room key, low-flush toilet, flourescent light bulbs, etc. The room price included breakfast and the staff was very accommodating to meet special diet requirements. My only regret regarding food is that I did not have an opportunity to eat dinner in the restaurant. The menu appears wonderful. This is where I will stay whenever I am in San Francisco. It is my new favorite hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Rocky1NewYork
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, with incredibly friendly, and extremely helpful staff, lovely rooms, nice breakfast buffet, great location, good value. I would definitely stay here the next time I'm in San Francisco, and would not hesitate to recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient!”
Reviews.Author: BurkeGustav
Reviews.Content: We started of our 15 night road trip honeymoon with 5 nights in the Orchard Garden. I had booked the room before the hotel opened and got a good rate. The room was spotless, lovely king size bed and a great view out onto the street. The bathroom was quite spacious, but we weren't so keen on the sliding door. I agree with the posters on the annoyance that there is no room to put your own water into the fridge provided. Breakfast was included and as other have said there was a good selection. Staff were friendly, but not overly. Location wise it's perfect. A few minutes up the road there is the cable car stop and down the hill Union Square. I would recommend this hotel and would stay again at the right price.

Reviews.Title: “A good base for exploring San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: PandB65
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel, located right next to the China Gate entrance to Chinatown. It is within easy walking distance of Union Square and there are plenty of cafes and restaurants close by. The rooms are stylishly decorated and even though our room was only one floor up and facing the street, it was pretty quiet. Nice toiletries and bathrobes are supplied. The continental breakfast provided an excellent selection of fruit, pastries, bread & cheese and cereals. The front desk staff were very helpful. On-line booking worked fine, and a reminder e-mail was sent to us a few days before our stay which was reassuring. This hotel provided a very comfortable start to a three week road trip around California. We would not hesitate to recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The Orchard Garden is a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zeca13
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited San Francisco this week. Based on Trip Advisor's user recommendations we chose The Orchard Garden Hotel and we had a great experience! The staff is very helpful, the room, if is not a big one, has a lot of options that we usually do not find in other hotels e.g. plasma TV and Ipod docking amplifier. The room was super clean and prepaid with breakfast included. We definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “All hotels should follow suit”
Reviews.Author: suplada
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights for a business trip. The location is great. Check-in was quick, the staff were very courteous and attentive. Free (European) breakfast was good, not too heavy - coffee, fruits, hardboiled eggs, ham, various kinds of bread, and i loved the pastries. The room, although on the small side, is immaculately clean, nicely furnished, very relaxing bed, flatscreen TV. The bathroom is actually a good size, not cramped at all, and very clean. What's weird though, is the hairdryer is a portable one. Not the normal ones you see hooked up on the wall in the bathroom. The water pressure in the shower is on the weak side (in my opinion). Check-out was uneventful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, especially since it's a LEED-certified hotel. Way to Go!

Reviews.Title: “Great Botique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fly121
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay at the Orchard Garden Hotel, it is located near Union Square with great access to all the shopping nearby. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Rooms were nice and clean. We had an interior room with not much a view but we were not in the room for long. The price we paid was expensive I thought, over $800 for 2 nights. 'm not sure if something was going on in the city or if that is the regular rate for rooms here. We also had a walk-thru door to the next room and the sound proffing was not very good. I would probably stay here again but check for better rates.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: frstbrn
Reviews.Content: I called the Orchard about a week before our visit on a last ditch effort to get a room here due to the positive reviews I saw on Trip Advisor ( I had booked somewhere else). I was lucky to find an open room and although the front desk could not lower the price (all hotels were booked and they were at full capacity) she did include breakfast in our stay which helped. Everyone was great. Although they do not have an official concierge desk like the big hotels each person went out of their way to help us find what we were looking for. each person gave us very personal service and always at 110%. Our rooms were very clean and comfortable. My brother is a big environmentalist and I have already recommended it to him but I will recommend it to everyone going to San Francisco. I honestly cannot think of a bad thing to say about the Orchard Garden. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Membermaine07
Reviews.Content: I found the Orchard Garden an excellent boutique hotel in San Francisco. The only reason why it doesn't get a 5.0 rating is the ambience, which I found a little sterile. It is a LEED-certified hotel, which means it follows environmentally-friendly practices in its energy management and overall business practices. If this is important to you you should stay here. You will not be disappointed by the quality of the experience. The rooftop garden is very nice although I wish it had a bar. You can bring your own up there and we did and enjoyed it. I'm surprised more people weren't up there. The location is excellent, northeast of Union Square makes it even more walkable to North Beach and the waterfront as well as Chinatown (next door). The room was very clean, excellent and very comfortable bed. Didn't eat in the restaurant so I can't comment on it. Breakfast was included in the rate and was good if not spectacular. The modern decor and light colored woods I thought were just a little sterile looking. That's my only complaint. I'd certainly recommend it, however.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless hotel...”
Reviews.Author: JonHarris
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this place. Cant fault it in any way. Huge room packed with facilities and a large bed and wonderful bathroom. My only complaint was the weak strength of the wi fi signal in my room which was too weak to be used. Otherwise I cannot fault the hotel and the location is excellent

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed vibe”
Reviews.Author: ldbparis
Reviews.Content: A really great hotel with lots of charm. Very clean and modern and efficient. I love the fact that it's LEED certified. The staff was very courteous although i was surprised no one helped get my bags up to the room. The contintental breakfast was also right on point. I got a great rate for this room as I was in town for a conference but I'm not sure I would pay the posted rate of $339 a night. The room was a little small - perfect for one person but 2 people would make it much more tight. Overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: orange24
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 3 night stay at the Orchard Garden Hotel. It's a great boutique hotel, very clean and reasonably priced. Service was friendly and helpful. The location couldn't be any better - close to Union Square, Chinatown, and restaurants. We would definitely stay at this hotel next time we're in San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: ashbay04
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the Orchard Garden Hotel was just heaven after a 13 hour flight from Sydney. Check-in was an ease and we were in our room within 10 minutes from arriving. The rooms are very clean, spacious and comfortable. I must say the best thing about the room was the bed, they are just amazing (best sleep for ages). We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights and found the location to be very central, within walking distance to Union Square and close to the cable cars. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Experience”
Reviews.Author: PontMarie
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Garden Hotel is a very low-keyed, understated but quietly luxurious hotel. There's an almost zen-like quality to the place. You walk into your room and immediately feel completely relaxed. The staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “We wished we didn't have to leave the Orchard Garden Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GreatholsBrighton_UK
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I visited the Orchard Garden Hotel for 8 nights and thorougly enjoyed the experience. The Double, double room with a view was lovely and a good size, as was the bathroom. Location superb for shopping and walking around. The friendliness and helpfullness of all the staff was a great plus, and we enjoyed sampling the house cocktails! Room service was excellent as was the meal in the restaurant. Altogether, our stay at the Orchard Garden Hotel was a delight.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and service”
Reviews.Author: manxgary
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights as part of our annual vacation from the UK. Excellent service and quality of furnishings. Noticed it's listed in Conde Nast 'hot list' for 2007. Location was fantastic, only a couple of blocks from Union square. We'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: NK02
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights in this hotel, and it exceeded all our expectations - most importantly, its location is superb. In a city with many hills, we were pleased to find that most of SF's attractions are close by, and for the visits to Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf, transport links were close to the hotel. The hotel itself was fantastic - very new feeling to the place, all furniture and fittings were spotless. Breakfast was more than adequate, and there is computer access in the 'Business Center'. Door staff were very helpful. Modestly priced for accomodation in an expensive city - if we are lucky enough to return to San Fran, we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “An absolute 'green' gem in the heart of San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: mbzray
Reviews.Content: We held our 40th Peace Corps Reunion at the Orchard Garden, and it could not have been better. Situated in the middle of San Francisco, just 50 feet from the entrance to Chinatown, the Orchard Garden was an ideal location for all of our friends who came in from all over the United States. The Orchard Garden is a beautiful, new, and environmentally sensitive hotel. The entry is fresh and inviting, providing an opportunity to instantly experience the friendly ambience that pervades throughout. The use of light colored woods and tall ceilings add to the qualtiy of the hotel. In the ground floor, "Roots" restaurant, the chicken ceasar sandwich, with carmelized brown sugar on bacon, is an absolute, must try delight. The rooms are nicely sized, bright, and cheery, and have all the internet connections one needs. Depositing your room key in a slot by the door powers up all the lights and helps to conserve energy. I did not expect a 'green' hotel to be so elegant. Throughout the hotel, the staff, from housekeepers to waitresses, to front office, were eager to help in any way to make our stay more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: wjh1953
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 days at the Orchard Garden and loved it. the room was great with a comfortable bed, beautiful and functional bathroom and nice amenities including a big screen TV. The breakfast buffet was substantial and varied. We ate dinner in the restaurant "Roots" one night and the food was fabulous and, for San Francisco, reasonable. The location was great for us -- right next to Chinatown and close to the public transportation hub of Market Street. We stayed in three other hotels on this trip in other parts of northern California and agree that the OG was the best. We'll definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dory92064
Reviews.Content: Was very pleased with the Orchard Garden Hotel. Room was spacious and very comfortable. Excellent location in the city. Did not eat in the restaurant, but did enjoy a glass of wine and some cheese in the comfortable bar area. Nice breakfast with a good selection of items. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GoBrewers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchard Garden for 4 nights (August 23-26). The staff - from the front desk clerk to the bellman to the restaurant workers - was friendly to a fault! We felt very welcome from the minute we arrived. We had a 8th floor view room with two double beds. The room was immaculate....the beds were insanely comfortable....the sheets were perfect.....flat screen TV...AC worked well...the room was incredibly quiet even though it looked out on Bush Street and was a half-block from the main gate of Chinatown. Your room key-card activates the room's electricity when you enter the room and place it into the power "receptacle". A fantastic way to cut down on the amount of electricity the hotel uses! The European buffet breakfast each day was excellent. Fresh baked croissants, fresh fruits, yogurt, cereals, juices, coffee....it was an excellent start each morning! The hotel is conveniently located to Chinatown, Union Square. We actually walked to AT&T Park as well as North Beach from the hotel (about a mile in either direction). However, there is alot of mass transit available close by. There is a rooftop terrace which is an excellent place to read and catch the afternoon sun. I whole-heartedly recommend it! Overall, I'd say this hotel stay was one of the best I have had! The hotel has earned a LEED "green" rating which makes all of the luxuriuos surriundings seem even more luxurious!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2lilly2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the perfect location. There were no steep hills to climb. The location is steps away from the entrance to China Town, the financial center, and Union Square. We booked a king with a view for $199.00 a night. Unbelievable for San Francisco! The hotel is new and a green hotel. Everyone we met was friendly and happy! We have spent a lot of vacations in San Francisco and stayed at many hotels, but in the future we will be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: TravelNonstop
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 408 and it was great. Everything was SO CLEAN and SO NEW and SO WELL DONE! I loved te sliding bathroom door and the beds were very comfy and so were the pillows and bedding. I'm turning "GREEN" so knowing I was helping give back was also a HUGE plus! I'd stay there everytime! Do beware that a soda at the bar will cost you $3.56 before tip! A bit pricey for a can of Sprite. Very convienent to everything. The Cafe across the street, Cade De le Presse is delicous! Order the french toast!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean, Hospitable”
Reviews.Author: FamilyFunNV
Reviews.Content: Our family thoroughly enjoyed a 6 day stay at the Orchard Garden. We arrived early in the morning and it was no problem to store our luggage for the day while we set off to explore the city. The check-in/check-out were smooth, the room was small but functional and tastefully decorated. The "green policy" appealed enormously to our family - especially our teenage daughters. The breakfast was terrific - the atmosphere was friendly, overall it was a very positive experience and we feel we got great value for our dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Mandy9939
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Garden Hotel is new and spotless!!!. The staff made us feel extremely welcome and we really appreciate this "green" hotel's efforts in recycling and protecting the environment. We were encouraged to take our cocktails and snacks up to the outdoor terrace where there was plenty of tables/chairs and a nice view. Our stay came with a complimentary breakfast which had something for everyone and was delicious. Just a couple of blocks away from Union Square, the location is very convenient to shopping, Chinatown, dining, etc. I would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “makes being green easy and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: greengirl2007
Reviews.Content: love the fact that a green hotel such as this exists! it was really cozy and comfy w/ unexpected perks like the sleep 101 cd in the room. super comfortable bed! great to have a green option to give my business to,just 1 more way to be the change we wish to see in the world:) loved it,would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Kitka2001
Reviews.Content: We booked the Orchard Garden for a girls weekend for two best friends and our 8 - 10 year old daughters. The location was great for that kind of trip. Two doors down from the gate to Chinatown meant a lot of great kid-friendly meals and shops. Quick walk to Union Square and transportation to the rest of the city. We booked two double rooms but were not told until arrival that each floor only has two double rooms - so one of us switched to a King room. This was fine with us but you should know this if expecting to be near traveling companions with the same room type booked. We did not get the City view and instead overlooked a courtyard and it was wonderfully quiet. I would definitely book standard again. The concierge at the Orchard Garden was great as was the night staff, who helped with everything with a smile. From hailing us the perfect taxi to recommending two very good restaurants, to getting us to the airport in time, the staff helped make the trip easier. The rooms were very clean and well stocked. The only thing I'd say was a negative was the mini-bar and snack trays which we nor the girls touched but seem to have been sensitive enough that we were charged for a water anyway. Not worth getting upset over but something to look out for. We did not try the restaurant as it was a bit pricey and there are so many affordable options within walking distance of the hotel. Would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelerLakeMary_Fl
Reviews.Content: We had just finished a stay at the Orchard Garden Hotel after a week of travel throughout California. Of all the places we stayed during our trip, the Orchard Garden was by far our favorite. The hotel as well as the room was extremely nice and we thought the amenities/bed in the room (the fact that it is a "Green" hotel was a definite plus) as well as the size of the room itself was perfect and comfortable for my wife and daughter. The hotel and lobby were very clean and the breakfast was great - scones, meat and cheese, etc. The location in the city next to Chinatown makes visiting that particular area of the city very easy and convenient. But the most overlooked part was simply the staff - from the valet to the desk person - they were extremely friendly and very accommodating. We had traveled to San Francisco from Malibu the day we checked in ... the staff made our transition into the room flawless, gave us directions and tips, all with a wonderful attitude throughout our entire stay. This was true even though when we checked in, we had about 15 minutes to get to a Giants game. This was a great experience and I will highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust74
Reviews.Content: The room: The Orchard Garden Hotel is a boutique hotel, so the rooms are tiny. However, the rooms are very clean and utilize the small space. The bed is amazing and the flat screen tv with a DVD player is a nice bonus. The only thing that I did not like about the room was the bathroom door, or lack there of. The "door" is actually a sliding panel that does not completely shut all the way. The breakfast: Free breakfast is included each morning. The breakfast choices include huge croissants, delicious scones and muffins, fruit, bagels, cold ham cuts, cheese, hard boiled eggs, cereals, juice, and coffee. The scones, croissants, and muffins were all quality and similar to those you would find at a nice pastry shop. The location: What a great location! You are right next to the Grant Avenue entrance to China Town. You are a few blocks from shopping at Union Square. You are approximately 3/4 a mile from Coit Tower and approximately 1 mile from the Embarcadero. We walked to dinner each night and found great restaurants in China Town, Little Italy, and North Beach. There were plenty of Muni bus stops in walking distance and the BART and Muni underground were four blocks away. We called "511", which is free if you call from the bay area, which allows you to speak with someone who will tell you what bus route to take to certain places and where the bus picks you up. We easily took the bus to the Golden Gate Park, the Presidio, the Golden Gate Bridge, and AT&T Park. You are in walking distance to many restaurants, coffee shops, and retail stores. However, many of the restaurants close by 10:00 pm. If you are a late night diner, then try Chinatown. Overall: I will definitely stay at this hotel again and recommend it to my friends and family. For $179 a night, the hotel is a deal. The location is perfect for those who want to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay at the Orchard Garden Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Freddy66
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night weekend stay at the Orchard Garden. It was a pleasant experience. The room cost $250.00 a night with AAA discount. The hotel is located close to shopping, restaurants, Starbucks, trolley stops and Union Square. It is a "Green Hotel." The rooms were nice and clean, if a bit on the small size. Nice bath products in the bathroom. We traveled with our two children ages 7 and 5. The hotel has free dvd's to rent and our kids watched a couple a movies while we were there on the room's plasma television. There was a complimentary breakfast each morning that was pretty good. There were muffins, bagels, and assorted breads along with fruit and cereal. We ate breakfast across the street at Cafe De La Presse one morning and spent 50 bucks for some pancakes and eggs. Frankly, the hotel breakfast was just as good and didn't cost us anything. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful with tips for getting around the city. At the front desk, a young man named Quinn was very friendly and always willing to answer any questions we might have had. All in all, it was a good decision to stay at the Orchard Garden Hotel. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “best beds ever”
Reviews.Author: RobynRAZ
Reviews.Content: Great location for walking the city. Wonderful beds and a environmentally conscience hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Orchard Garden Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 466 Bush Street, San Francisco, CA 94108
